programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate alleged sightings of UFOs during the Black Death, and examine the theory that aliens may have inflicted the disease on the human race.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick searches for a pair of 1920s petrol pumps, but a 1930s horse-gambling wheel catches his eye.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team returns a 1950s Wurlitzer jukebox to its former glory, while Rick makes a deal to buy a 1940s vending machine.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick salvages a film projector that is more than 100 years old and two 1950s petrol-station showpieces.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick offers to repair a vintage mechanical bull, and also restores a 1940s soft drinks machine.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike makes a gamble by buying an elephant's head from a taxidermist, and the guys are tempted to purchase an antique hot dog steamer.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of three new crews - S and S Aqua Logging, Rygaard Logging and R and R Conner Aviation, which uses helicopters to shift felled trees.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The logging season begins, with the stakes as well as the temperature rising, as the lumberjacks brave alligator-infested swamps.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick takes on the challenge of restoring a weighing machine from the 1900s, while the team also tackles a 1930s baby walker.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick works his magic on a vintage Italian bumper car from an antiques shop, while the team repairs a 1970s toy tractor.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team investigates disturbingly similar stories of alien abductions from two different countries before tracking down some potential proof in Mexico.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team investigates rumours of human-alien genetic experiments reportedly going on deep below the New Mexico desert in an underground base.

programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: Part two of two. A continuation of the investigation into what would happen if there was a repeat of the 1906 San Francisco Earthquake.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank explore a crumbling building full of salvaged gems, but have a hard time getting the valuables out safely before the roof caves in.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank have an unsuccessful search through a pile of junk, but the discovery of a vintage guitar marks a change in their fortunes.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions mount when a man loses his temper over a mix-up with his gold chain. Meanwhile, an allegedly cursed relic scares Ashley.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Members of the Gold family open the doors to their huge Detroit pawn shop once again as they encounter intriguing finds and awkward customers.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Gold family and its employees are ready to haggle as members of the public continue to bring in their unique items in the hope of raising some cash.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer wants to sell a coat allegedly made of rare monkey fur. Seth is tempted to make a purchase that could prove beneficial to the finances of the business.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The toss of a coin determines the value of a gold chain Les believes is out of fashion. A customer is upset when Seth prevents her from using the staff toilets.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman rejects custom-made earrings, as she thought the term diamond cut meant they were diamonds. Seth puts his faith into younger sellers, believing they can outperform Les.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene and Casey return to the auctions only to be greeted by fierce competition. Dave finds a piece of board game history.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon have high hopes when they return to the site of one of their greatest triumphs, while the other bidders take on the self-proclaimed king of storage.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon fight over a piece of movie history, and Rene plans to make the other bidders pay dearly for coming to his home town.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Up the Ante in El Monte
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod try to outwit their rivals at an auction in El Monte, but face disaster if their plan backfires.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers return to Montebello, California, where Rene and Casey unsuccessfully try to throw off the competition. Ivy secures his skating equipment.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene and Casey attempt to shut out Jarrod and Brandi, Darrell uncovers an interesting locker, while Ivy meets a furry friend. Reality series following people who make a living from bidding for the contents of abandoned storage units.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy tries to keep his winning streak going, while Darrell and Rene play mind games with each other. Jarrod and Brandi visit a crime scene and travel back in time.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi is intent on closing the Long Beach store, but Jarrod is determined to save it by scoring more lockers. Ivy tries to intimidate other buyers, while Darrell gets the shock treatment.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Return of the King of Montebello
programme.desc: Ivy hires someone to look after his shop, while Jarrod and Brandi split up for auctions in Montebello.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: For a Good Time, Call Ivy
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi are under financial pressure, and fear they will lose one of their shops if they do not make a profitable bid soon.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths are tasked with forging the iconic KA-BAR military blade using only tiny cubes of W-1 steel. The two remaining competitors have five days in their forges to recreate the battle-tested Glaive Guisarme.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.sub-title: Voyage to the Bottom of the Cenote
programme.desc: After making a potentially historic find in the Money Pit area, a massive and mysterious cave-in threatens brothers Marty and Rick Lagina and their team with disaster.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Troy and Guy race to fill tags as the end of the season looms near, while Jacob and Chase have a surprise encounter fishing in their backyard.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The Landrys race to tag out at the end of the season, but they have company, as RJ and Jay Paul invade their territory looking to tag out themselves.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain returns with a timely new run of the topical comedy show, with Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, James Acaster, Milton Jones and Tez Ilyas joining regular panellist Hugh Dennis to take a comic look at what's been happening in the news through stand-up and improvised games.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Pointless host Alexander Armstrong takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from October 2018, with BBC Breakfast presenter Naga Munchetty and comedian Josh Widdicombe joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.sub-title: That's What Debt Actually Is, Actually
programme.desc: The comedian discusses a convoluted way of getting rid of an unwanted gift, reimagines a classic game show, and reveals how the diamond industry could be brought to its knees.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Unable to convince Lucy that he did not smash a blue and white antique vase that belonged to her grandmother, Lee summons the family to a meeting to flush out the culprit.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy takes the kids away to her parents while Lee stays in the house to oversee the building work being done their kitchen, but unfortunately the tradesman he has employed has an annoyingly relaxed attitude to deadlines. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Tom Allen, Ed Byrne, Rhys James and Ellie Taylor join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Hugh Dennis undertake a perilous journey through the Peruvian Andes. Their route takes in 2,000ft drops, one-lane dirt roads, remote mountain trails and muddy, humid jungle terrain, as they search for the lost city of Constitucion, once destined to be the capital of Peru.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Intrepid gravity-fuelled Soapbox Racers take on Observatory Hill overlooking Helsinki Harbour. How will they handle the brutal berm, the car wash and the ferocious kickers?.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and a team of kayakers head to the Himalayas to visit the last great unexplored river in Bhutan. Legend has it that at some point, the river drops off the face of the planet.

programme.title: Top Gear: Winter Blunderland
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May present their best winter challenges, including playing ice hockey with Suzukis and what occurs if you ski-jump a rocket-powered Mini.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Festive edition from 2008 in which Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on one of the most spectacular road trips they have ever attempted. Arriving in Vietnam, they are challenged to travel the entire length of the country in just eight days. First they must buy suitable transport for the journey, and despite having several million Dong in their pockets, this proves more difficult than they expected, especially in one of the most expensive car markets in the world.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compare the Mercedes SLS, the Porsche 911 GT3 RS and the Ferrari 458 Italia, as they race against each other in an epic road trip up America's east coast.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The conclusion of the two-part special in which Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May take three used, V8-engined sports cars on a gruelling road trip covering 1,600 miles through Patagonia to the world's southernmost city. Having encountered stunning landscapes, mechanical mishaps and dreadful roads on their journey through Argentina, the trio's adventure is brought to a dramatic climax by a terrifying turn of events.

programme.title: Top Gear: Winter Blunderland
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May present their best winter challenges, including playing ice hockey with Suzukis and what occurs if you ski-jump a rocket-powered Mini.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The teams take on one of the steepest courses in Red Bull Soapbox Race history in Lithuania. Will the soapboxes cope with the water jump and savage bone-rattler?.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and David Baddiel travel along more than 1,200 miles of hazardous roads in Ethiopia on a journey to Aksum, the country's holiest place. However, they have to contend with more than fatigue and unreliable terrain to reach their destination, as they encounter drug-taking truck drivers, suffer a disastrous breakdown and start to run out of fuel at the worst possible time.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended version of the quiz in which Jason Manford, Romesh Ranganathan and Holly Walsh join regular participant Alan Davies to vie for points awarded for interesting - if not always correct - answers. In a Christmas-themed edition, the panellists learn the best way to wrap an awkwardly shaped present and get wine stains out of a carpet.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Pointless host Alexander Armstrong takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from October 2018, with BBC Breakfast presenter Naga Munchetty and comedian Josh Widdicombe joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain returns with a timely new run of the topical comedy show, with Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, James Acaster, Milton Jones and Tez Ilyas joining regular panellist Hugh Dennis to take a comic look at what's been happening in the news through stand-up and improvised games.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies challenges his five fearful funny people to entertain him by completing more baffling challenges, which this week involve corneas, crackers and construction.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Outnumbered star Hugh Dennis, presenter Ben Fogle, newsreader Kate Silverton and Strictly Come Dancing judge Craig Revel Horwood are this week's guests on the comedy panel show. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack guide the contestants as they try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: On the Welsh Highland Railway, a newly built Pullman carriage is on its way to Caernarfon Station and a Saddle Tank Loco is being completely restored on the East Lancashire Railway.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: How the steam train reached the height of its importance in Europe just as fresh innovations were being made in America, with groundbreaking trains like the Burlington Zephyr.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: On the final leg of his journey, the comedian crosses 1,000 miles of South Africa, reaching the most southerly passenger railway station on the continent. Heading to Johannesburg, he reveals how the city has benefited from the scale of gold-mining in the area. Later on, he takes to the skies in a light aircraft for a bird's-eye view of one of South Africa's largest ostrich farms, and catches one of the world's most luxurious trains for a seven-hour ride to Cape Town, before reaching the coastal settlement of Simon's Town.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: A profile of Robert Cecil, a formidable political operator who devised and established an extraordinary web of spies and informers designed to ensure King James I's security.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Shakespeare - The Legacy with John Nettles
programme.desc: The actor examines the life of the Bard, investigating key moments and trying to discover what may have happened in a seven-year gap where he disappears from historical records.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: Profile of Cardinal Richelieu, who as Louis XIII's diabolical chief minister, was feared and hated thanks to his complex spy network.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates this documentary chronicling events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7, 1941, and the subsequent collapse of unprepared British forces before the advancing enemy in Singapore. Includes interviews with veterans from both sides.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough focuses on animals living in deserts. Cameras explore the dry Atacama of Chile, where guanacos survive by licking dew off cacti, and capture the rare sight of wild camels eating snow to stay hydrated on Mongolia's Gobi plains. In the rocky Namibian desert, elephants desperately search for food and lions wander the wilderness hunting oryx.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Camera crews follow the activities of wildlife in the Arctic and Antarctic, including an emperor penguin colony's nine-month migration across sea ice to its breeding ground. The team also takes aerial and underwater shots to capture humpback whales feeding and tracks a male polar bear as it swims 100km to find new ice from which to hunt seals.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The wildlife on the great plains of Africa, Asia, North America and the Arctic, which cover a quarter of the land on Earth. The distinctive Tibetan fox is captured on film for the first time, while a herd of caribou migrates 2,000 miles across the tundra in search of grass. Night vision equipment tracks a pride of 30 lions hunting elephants in the tropical African savannah near one of the region's few remaining waterholes. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An insight into woodlands around the world, from the stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice in the Arctic forests, to the broadleaf woods in North America and Europe. Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascar's unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough focuses on animals living in deserts. Cameras explore the dry Atacama of Chile, where guanacos survive by licking dew off cacti, and capture the rare sight of wild camels eating snow to stay hydrated on Mongolia's Gobi plains. In the rocky Namibian desert, elephants desperately search for food and lions wander the wilderness hunting oryx.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Camera crews follow the activities of wildlife in the Arctic and Antarctic, including an emperor penguin colony's nine-month migration across sea ice to its breeding ground. The team also takes aerial and underwater shots to capture humpback whales feeding and tracks a male polar bear as it swims 100km to find new ice from which to hunt seals.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The wildlife on the great plains of Africa, Asia, North America and the Arctic, which cover a quarter of the land on Earth. The distinctive Tibetan fox is captured on film for the first time, while a herd of caribou migrates 2,000 miles across the tundra in search of grass. Night vision equipment tracks a pride of 30 lions hunting elephants in the tropical African savannah near one of the region's few remaining waterholes. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An insight into woodlands around the world, from the stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice in the Arctic forests, to the broadleaf woods in North America and Europe. Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascar's unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Studio and concert performance from the decade, featuring the Who, Queen, David Bowie, the Moody Blues, the Rolling Stones and Elton John.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Studio and concert performances from the decade, featuring Aretha Franklin, Bill Withers, Rose Royce, the Real Thing and Michael Jackson.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Studio and concert performances from the decade, featuring Free, Deep Purple, Jethro Tull, Yes and Dr Feelgood.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: A collection of studio and concert performances from the decade, featuring the Carpenters, Wings, Abba and Kate Bush.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Selection of archive performances from the decade, including music by singer-songwriters including Carole King, James Taylor, Neil Young, Randy Newman and Don McLean.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: A selection of archive performances from the decade, featuring the Eagles, Eric Clapton and Dire Straits.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Punk and new wave music, including vintage sessions by the Clash, Joy Division, the Buzzcocks, X-Ray Spex, the Damned and the Undertones.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: America's punk and new wave era in the 1970s, featuring acts including Alice Cooper, the New York Dolls, Iggy Pop, the Ramones and Bruce Springsteen.

programme.title: The First Silent Night
programme.desc: Simon Callow discovers the origin of the Christmas carol and the story of the two Austrians who wrote it.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The apparent suicide of a DJ leads Nikki to question her judgement in a strikingly similar case from her past and she brings the potential mistake to the attention of her colleagues, but the news threatens to have repercussions for the family of the deceased, the police and the Lyell Centre. The fresh evidence leads to the conclusion that a copycat killer is at large and Nikki finds evidence that an intruder has been entering her home. Feature-length episode of the drama, starring Emilia Fox.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages and picking up as the tumultuous War of the Roses comes to an end, a new generation ascends to the throne in a tale of power, political clashes, family, love and betrayal. As the victor of the Battle of Bosworth, Henry Tudor, is set to ascend the throne and Elizabeth of York and her family, supporters of the former King, find themselves in grave danger. Lizzie must fulfil her promise to marry King Henry VII and bring peace to the nation. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh struggles to prove his innocence and win back Penny after failing a drug test. Meryl and Charlie lock horns over Hayley's entry in the Miss Whyhope competition.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits Barton House in the Cotswolds, where the garden is usually devoid of flowers.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As June and Jim prepare to tie the knot, the past threatens to catch up with both of them and shatter their happiness. Evil Gabriel plays mind games with the pair, suggesting the marriage is merely a sham, while Jim's drunken ex-wife Marie makes an unscheduled appearance - but will love conquer all? The romance of the occasion goes to Reg and Marilyn's heads, while back at the station, Adam gets lured into a trap that could destroy his career.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Still working undercover, Kerry gets in way over her head after witnessing the death of a Radford escort girl and being ordered to give one of the others a beating, and Rob begins to fear the worst when she goes for days without reporting back. As Neil's relationship with Andrea blossoms, he lets slip some of his most closely guarded secrets about his colleagues - not least big cheese Adam Okaro - which soon end up on the front pages of the newspapers. Gina is distraught to discover Jonathan has requested a transfer to another station.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Dale realises that Kerry has embarked on a foolhardy undercover mission to investigate the Radford clan and tracks her down, begging her to pull out before it's too late - but she turns a deaf ear to his pleas, putting both their lives in peril. Newlyweds Jim and June return to Sun Hill to be met by a mob of journalists baying for Adam's blood, while Reg begins to have second thoughts about pursuing a relationship with Marilyn.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Although she and Dale are rescued from the Radfords' murderous clutches, Kerry's problems are just beginning as Gina gets wind of her undercover mission and vows to end her career in the force. A heated argument between Adam and Rob ends with the latter being issued a formal warning, and Sam fears the worst when her teenage daughter Abi goes missing. A paedophilia case reopens old wounds for Terry - but can he explain to a shocked Ramani why he accessed a child pornography website?.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The threatened closure of Goddard's following the outbreak of a virus among the children of Skelthwaite prompts Vic to speculate on the real source of the contamination. Meanwhile, Simon and Anna have relationship problems. Rural drama, starring Lesley Dunlop and Leslie Ash.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Intrigue and frustration are the order of the day as Anna and Karen come to terms with the possibility that a patient may be suffering domestic abuse. Jess finally gets what's coming to her, while Dick, Cheryl and Oscar struggle to settle into family life. Drama, starring Lesley Dunlop, Leslie Ash and Phil Middlemiss.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The Skelthwaite Scorpions hop across the Channel for a match with their twin-town team. The competition doesn't take up all their time, however, as Vic finds his uncle's war grave. Simon, meanwhile, has a rendezvous with a local businesswoman and Chris falls for a hiker.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne receives an SOS from Holloway Prison, whose usual maternity workers have been struck down by illness, and when she and Trixie step in to help, the nun puts her reputation on the line to prevent a heavily pregnant convict having her unborn baby taken away by social services. Shelagh faces heartache when a routine pregnancy check reveals something far more serious, Alec has a confession for Jenny, and Fred takes the gang to the theatre to celebrate Chummy's birthday - only for the trip to end in disaster. Lacey Turner, best known as EastEnders' Stacey Branning, guest stars.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny has an eventful few days, starting with a patient who as well as having herself to worry about, is also struggling to cope with her mother, an agoraphobic who hasn't been outside for at least 12 years. On top of that, Alec asks the midwife to accompany him to Brighton for the weekend, leaving her wondering if his intentions are strictly honourable. However, things soon take a tragic turn. Meanwhile, Shelagh joins the local choir to take her mind off her problems. Jessica Raine, Leo Staar and Laura Main star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives are busy preparing for Sister Evangelina's surprise jubilee celebrations, marking 50 years since she took her vows, but a face from the past threatens to ruin the party for the guest of honour. It's back to business when a young woman with Down's syndrome is brought in feeling unwell. To everyone's surprise, they discover she is six months pregnant, causing some of them to think the worst, and the staff are joined by new nurse Patsy, whose sense of humour and no-nonsense attitude make her an instant hit.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie is chuffed when local curate Tom invites her to join him for a day of cricket, sending her to work with a spring in her step. Is love on the cards for the young midwife? Shelagh's infertility has made her think long and hard about what she wants in life, so she approaches her husband with an idea, while Patsy upsets a young mother in the clinic and is moved to the district rota, where she works tirelessly to diagnose a docker's unusual symptoms.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.sub-title: Are You Being Served? Special Christmas 1979
programme.desc: The staff of Grace Brothers stage a life-size Punch and Judy show to entertain a group of their colleagues' children. Christmas special of the vintage comedy, starring John Inman.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates when the new wife of Sir Raleigh is found dead in a locked room after seeing an Egyptian mummy. Crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The island is rocked when Saint Marie's governor Caroline Bamber drops dead at her leaving party, with the commissioner standing right next to her. As DI Goodman and the team try to deduce how she could have been poisoned without their boss noticing any foul play, they find themselves entering the murky world of island politics, where blackmail, threats and corruption seem commonplace - fuelled by ongoing tension between the French and British. Meanwhile, Humphrey braves the world of online dating, under the guidance of ladies' man Dwayne - and soon finds his perfect match. Lucy Cohu and Nigel Lindsay guest star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The murder of Amir Aziz, a prominent anti-fundamentalist Muslim, drags the Lyell team into the murky world of hate-crime and counter-terrorism. Initially thought to be the work of a EDL member whose son was killed by the Taliban, the team begin to suspect the killing is connected to Sarah Begovic, a young woman who left the UK to relocate to Syria, but who recently returned home in secret with her six-month-old son. Feature-length episode of the crime drama, starring Richard Lintern.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: Update on the day's headlines, plus a weather report.

programme.title: Basic Instinct (1992)
programme.desc: A hard-drinking San Francisco cop investigates the case of a man murdered with an ice-pick, but his normally well-honed intuition starts letting him down as he falls for the sultry and manipulative chief suspect, the victim's former girlfriend. Thriller from director Paul Verhoeven, starring Sharon Stone, Michael Douglas, George Dzundza and Jeanne Tripplehorn.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Actress, comedian and writer Helen Lederer throws today's dinner party, and Brian McFadden provides another four diners with cryptic clues hinting at the identity of their mystery hostess.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: How to Spend It Well at Christmas with Phillip Schofield
programme.desc: The This Morning presenter returns to put more Christmas gifts to the test, aided by his wife Steph, celebrity guests and members of the public. They begin by gearing up for Black Friday with tips on the best gifts and gadgets on the market. With sales of personal electric vehicles on the up, Corrie trio Jack P Shepherd (David), Alan Halsall (Tyrone) and Colson Smith (Craig) put hoverboards and scooters to the test. Clare Balding is on a mission to find the perfect present for pets and Eddie 'the Eagle' Edwards ranks gift experiences such as track racing, skydiving and flyboarding.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: A martian scientist gets lost in an underground cave, leading Virgil, Alan and Captain Taylor to assist.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's in Blackpool but is he brave enough to walk to the top of the UK's tallest rollercoaster?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz beams himself into Weasel's brain in order to take out Magoo with tranquilliser darts. Magoo loses Mr Cat and enlists his neighbour to find him..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's in a triathlon and takes Fizz's superhuman strength headband, which Fizz needs to beat the President at a thumb war.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Today's the big day, and Magoo believes he is in a recording studio to make a hit single for famous producer, Phil Dustspeck. But is that really true?.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The popular halfwit enters a competition to win a trolley of free food. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood film. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: The Sara Cox Show
programme.sub-title: The Sara Cox Show at Christmas
programme.desc: Sara is joined by author Marian Keyes and sports pundit Chris Kamara, and there is live music from Will Young. Plus, some last-minute gift ideas for under £20 and a Christmas breakfast feast from Georgina Hayden.

programme.title: Beautiful Baking with Juliet Sear
programme.desc: Juliet conjures up some ideas for Christmas, including baked party canapes, a brussels sprouts tarte tatin and a spectacular chocolate orange profiteroles tower. Liam Charles pays a visit to serve up Christmas lunch on a sheet of ruff puff pastry and Juliet visits chef Chantelle Nicholson in her London restaurant to sample a vegan main course Christmas meal.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John and Lisa cook up some family festive favourites, including glazed ham, a baked Tunworth cheese with onions and potatoes, and mini turkey and ham pies. Plus, Lisa decorates the tree with some beautiful Christmas biscuits.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha and Alex Hollywood help to prepare a festive family feast, including Nadia's annual tradition of hot sausage and cheddar rolls for breakfast, ginger gammon with tartiflette for lunch, a recipe for the ultimate turkey dinner, and Alex's delicious alternative to dessert with a white chocolate, raspberry and cranberry brioche for pudding.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Scott investigate when a man collapses and dies outside a pub after a fight with his brother-in-law. The discovery of suspicious burn marks on the victim's forehead reveals sinister secrets and when a second body is found, the detectives are drawn into a world of superstition and family tensions. Murder mystery with John Nettles, John Hopkins and guest starring Geoffrey Whitehead.

programme.title: How to Spend It Well at Christmas with Phillip Schofield
programme.desc: The presenter takes a look at the best Christmas deals on food and drink. The stars of The Real Housewives of Cheshire take a blind taste test to see if they can tell the difference between supermarket sparkling wine and real champagne. Mother and daughter Janet Ellis and Sophie Ellis-Bextor get to grips with some 1970s-style retro kitchen appliances, and Matt Tebbutt samples Phillip's efforts with a DIY home gin-making kit.

programme.title: The Big Quiz
programme.sub-title: The Big Soap Quiz: Coronation Street v Emmerdale
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the annual clash between ITV's biggest soaps, with team captains Jack P Shepherd (David Platt) and Mark Charnock (Marlon Dingle) returning to lead colleagues from Coronation Street and Emmerdale in a battle to find out who knows their soap best. Lining up from the cobbles are Sue Nicholls (Audrey Roberts), Alan Halsall (Tyrone Dobbs) and Alexandra Mardell (Emma Brooker), while making their way from the Dales are Lisa Riley (Mandy Dingle), Isabel Hodgins (Victoria Sugden) and Nick Miles (Jimmy King).

programme.title: The Pride of Britain Awards
programme.desc: Carol Vorderman, who is synonymous with the uplifting annual event, hits the road to visit some of the ceremony's winners over its two-decade history. In Torbay, she catches up with winners of the Emergency Services award - six of the seven crew of the RNLI who risked their lives to save eight stranded seamen. Carol walks the walk with fundraiser of the year 2008 Nina Barough and does a milk round with crime-fighting milkman and now MBE Tony Fowler. She also meets Rachel Edwards, who aged seven collected a Child of Courage award in 2001.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a Christmas Celebrity Special of the game show, with Davina McCall, Jarvis Cocker and Jo Brand hoping to win the £50,000 jackpot for their chosen charity. That's if they can guess what Mr Chips is doing.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby present the launch show for the 12th series of the skating challenge. The famous faces taking part this year are magician Ben Hanlin, reality TV star Maura Higgins, Diversity member Perri Kiely, model and businesswoman Caprice, TV presenter Trisha Goddard, actress Lisa George, Paralympian Libby Clegg, ex-EastEnder Joe Swash, Steps singer Ian 'H' Watkins, newsreader Lucrezia Millarini, and former footballer Kevin Kilbane. Also appearing here is TV personality Michael Barrymore, although a broken wrist suffered after the recording of this programme has ruled him out of the main show, and he is replaced by former Blue Peter host Radzi Chinyanganya. In this first edition, the celebrities are paired up with their professional partners, while Torvill and Dean also perform a spectacular routine with some special guests, before taking to the judges' desk alongside Ashley Banjo and newcomer John Barrowman.

programme.title: Quantum of Solace (2008)
programme.desc: James Bond sets out on a personal mission of vengeance as he pursues the secret criminal organisation Quantum. His search leads him to the head of an ecological corporation, who is plotting to orchestrate a coup in a Latin American country to get his hands on a precious natural resource. Spy thriller sequel, starring Daniel Craig, Olga Kurylenko, Judi Dench, Gemma Arterton and Mathieu Amalric.

programme.title: Ball & Boe: A Very Merry Christmas
programme.desc: After the huge success of their previous albums and sold-out tours, Michael Ball and Alfie Boe reunite for a festive night of music. Showcasing both their unique blend of extraordinary talent and infectious humour, the duo perform exciting new material alongside some Christmas favourites, as well as singing with special guests Shirley Bassey, Luke Evans and Gregory Porter.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Investigating a UFO crash that was believed to be a Soviet satellite. Plus, a probe sent to Mars discovers evidence of frozen water on the red planet.

programme.title: The Unexplained Files
programme.sub-title: Peruvian Alien Skull and Baltic Sea UFO
programme.desc: A tiny skeleton defies medical explanation in Peru, and this programme investigates if it is a missing link in human evolution or proof of extra-terrestrial contact.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: The comedian, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and team captains Kerry Godliman and Andy Parsons, oversees a battle between The Beehive from Somerset and the Wheelwright Arms from Chester.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Footage of heart-pounding getaways, including cabs running wild on the streets, and unfortunate and dramatic miscalculations of load height.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of what happens when animals challenge vehicles over right-of-way on the road. Plus, dangerous drag races.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Footage of train crash explosions, storm chasers who narrowly escape death, a window platform smashing into a building, cars and trucks colliding and a helicopter accident.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Footage of firefighters caught up in an explosion, missile warheads exploding in a tunnel, an avalanche burying a city, and a racing car snapping in two at 310mph.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Mike Kennedy calls in his team to snag a Czechoslovakian fighter jet, and Ken Cage and Danny Thompson end up under fire after going after a $2million Citation CJ1.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: A man asks the team to carry out a makeover on a friend's truck to pay him back for the kidney he donated.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Junk experts Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit Dan, a born-and-raised New Englander whose collection might turn out to be off-limits.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Junk experts Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz are picking and dreaming in California when Mike falls for the sweetest classic Ford pick-up he has ever seen.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Junk expert Frank Fritz falls hard for a Harley Davidson 'knucklehead' at a collector's hidden California compound.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Ploughing through a 40-acre salvage yard, junk experts Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz harvest a few lost treasures, including a never-before-seen farmer's mini-bike.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: Action from the latest EFL fixtures, including Fulham v Leeds United, Cardiff City v Preston North End and West Bromwich Albion v Brentford.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard searches the UK for valuable scrap items. He tries to make a profit on a collection of 19th-century balconet rails, finds himself bartering with a baronet at one of Scotland's grandest estates and is given a run for his money by a seasoned salvager.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard continues his search for valuable scrap items in Scotland, where he bargains for a Victorian canopy and examines goods in a boxer's back garden. He also hopes to make a profit from a collection of opaline lights.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard continues his search for valuable scrap items in the UK, visiting an antique dealer whose stock includes a lamp that could make his entire trip worthwhile. He also searches for treasures in a Somerset estate's coach house.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard examines strange salvage items at a beachside sale, which includes a collection of vintage skateboards and surfboards.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard is on the lookout for special items as he travels to Norway to browse a collection of classic car parts. Later, his salvage buddy Drew is keen to buy antlers.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: The boys continue their Norwegian journey, knowing they need to fill up the van or the trip will make a loss. They head to a Bergen salvage yard, but will they find any useful items in time?.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard meets his match in north Wales during a negotiation, finds forgotten treasures on a Warwick estate, and haggles with a hoarder from Wiltshire.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard haggles with a head teacher, squeezes into a hoarder's shed and takes a tour of a grand country house as he searches for more saleable items.

programme.title: Swimming with Monsters with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist joins forces with behavioural experts, scientists and extreme divers to swim with fascinating but deadly animals. His journey begins in Mexico, where he learns all about the great white shark. Leaving the safety of his dive cage, he hopes to be able to study the predator at close quarters.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Experts try to restore family heirlooms and treasured possessions to their former glory in time for Christmas. Among the items is a Victorian version of a jukebox called a Polyphon, that has rusted into silence. It moves sisters Ann and Kathryn to tears when they hear it play the family's favourite carol for the first time in decades.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: The Security and Customs Services at the borders of Spain, who are under constant threat from drugs, weapons and suspected terrorists.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: The Security and Customs Services at the borders of Spain, who are under constant threat from drugs, weapons and suspected terrorists.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Images of Mercury reveal spider-like formations on its surface which may be an odd geological formation or something more ominous.

programme.title: The Lost Women of NXIVM
programme.desc: An in-depth investigation into the four women members of Keith Raniere's NXIVM cult, whose members either vanished or died in mysterious circumstances.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 26-year-old pregnant student Loretta Saunders. Her body was found 12 days after she went missing in February 2014, dumped off a Canadian highway, hundreds of miles from her home. Heavy snow had prevented it from being discovered earlier.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Carla Fuqua, who vanished after a night out with friends in October 2009. A dedicated mother, it was known that the 28-year-old would never leave her son behind. More alarmingly, Carla became the fourth missing person in a town of less than 5,000. Her remains were found three years later in a wooded area in Alabama, but eventually her kiiller was caught.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Officers reveal a sophisticated burglary with estimated losses of £8million when they investigate why a bank manager is unable to open his vault.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: As summer arrives, temperatures soar to more than 100 degrees. Mark rescues a skinny Rottweiler chained out in the sun and investigators seek out kittens trapped under roof tiles.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A West Highland Terrier called Chester dislikes skateboarders. Concerned that he will bite someone, his owners take him to see Chris to see if he can help tame him.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A dream dress turns into a nightmare, and a customer finally finds her perfect gown - only to realise it costs double her budget.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Tamara looks for a gown that makes a statement, while Stephanie arrives for her fitting, not yet convinced she has bought the right dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A customer visits the shop who is getting married later that day and needs a dress immediately.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A pet dog is in trouble after swallowing a soft toy and Lisa is worried he will not survive. Chris Brown treats a lamb born without hooves, leading to lameness.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Lisa treats a stray beagle requiring emergency surgery to repair a dislocated hip. Tim needs to handle a venomous and angry king cobra.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Lee's anger issues jeopardise his relationship with Rena and threaten to derail their weight-loss journeys. Plus, a major life event sends Sarah into depression.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Bedridden for four years, Penny knows her weight may kill her unless drastic actions are taken, and hopes to have a gastric bypass before it is too late.

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy investigates Louise's cat Pip, a one-eyed cerebral hypoplasia feline, which will not stop tormenting and attacking the owner's other cat, Red. Plus, Erin's moggy Autumn causes havoc by urinating in several places around the home, including the settee, beds, kitchen worktops, microwave, computer monitor and backpacks.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Lindsay wants a new dress to replace one that has been ruined, while Caitlyn has already spotted her dream outfit at another salon, but could not find the right size.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Sarah has her hands full with Rachel, who wants a sexy wedding dress with lots of bling, while Melissa has a limited budget and no idea what she is looking for.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Carla wants a glitzy gown, but her mother prefers something elegant and sophisticated, while Natasha hopes wedding shopping will help her reconnect with her mum.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Adrianna's choice of dress leads to a nervous fitting, while Joey hopes to make a decision, having tried on more than 100 gowns.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Carli arrives at the salon with an entourage in tow, while Jessica brings her baby, mother, aunt and two friends to attend her wedding dress fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Ivania returns to Kleinfeld Bridal for a reselection, hoping her fiance will agree to the dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Margarita already has two gowns but is determined to buy a third, while wedding-obsessed Amanda begins searching for her dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nicole and her vocal family visit the store, while Amanda's mother refuses to leave until her daughter's dress is fixed.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nancy's father and uncle join in and help consultant Diane search for an ideal dress, while bride Nicole relies on her dad for a second opinion.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Cherine's fantasy is to resemble an Egyptian Barbie on her wedding day, while Jessica seeks a dress that will look good with fairy wings.

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. There's seldom a dull moment with model, businesswoman and celebrity Katie Price, so cameras follow her life and activities.

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Katie accepts an award in Dublin, tensions mount in her love life. With the prospect of bankruptcy looming, she recruits expert help to control her spending.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs and Lisa Joyner team up to find out why a woman was separated from her birth family when she was two. The miraculous journey resolves many family mysteries.

programme.title: James Patterson's Murder Is Forever
programme.desc: The best-selling author revisits the 2015 case of Dee Dee Blancharde, who was stabbed to death in their house. Less than 48 hours later, daughter Gypsy and her online boyfriend Nicholas Godejohn were arrested for her mother's murder.

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: Relatives of 'The Pillow Pyro' John Orr reveal how his shocking crimes impacted the family and community, and discuss whether there were any signs of his murderous intentions.

programme.title: Embarrassing Fat Bodies
programme.desc: Doctors Christian Jessen, Dawn Harper and Pixie McKenna deal with the impact obesity can have on fertility, and excess hair caused by polycystic ovaries. There is also advice for a man concerned about the size of his chest.
